WRITING.TEXT: It only gets worse :)
Emisil 3rd generation STP! It comes with a rod you can insert to become hard in case you want to mess around ;)

Holy shit I never thought I #8217;d find someone else who has this fear. First time I had my blood drawn I was 12, and before I even knew what was going on I passed out. I can #8217;t handle blood being taken and when I sleep I can #8217;t wear hoodies because the hoodie presses ever so slightly on my neck and it makes me nauseous. When I become aware of my breathing I have to distract myself because I become queasy. So glad someone else goes through this. My entire family makes fun of me for it and always has. I just don #8217;t know what to do about it because exposure does NOT work for me.
Idk if I should feel jealous because of how handsome you are or turned on. Either way I #8217;d kill to stuff you
Thank you so much #129402;

WRITING.TITLE: Living with venephobia as a trans man.
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve lived with severe venephobia (fear of veins and arteries.) almost my entire life. It #8217;s absolutely debilitating. I can #8217;t even think about the mechanics of a blood draw without getting dizzy, and have even seized when getting it done. I #8217;ve finally gotten to the point where I can look at the veins on my hands and feet, but the fear still lingers. All I want is to transition, but the very thought of going through it terrifies me. Sometimes I convince myself that the outcome isn #8217;t worth the terror I would feel, which sounds silly. My phobia mixed in with the need to transition has made me question whether or not I should just end my life to save all the trouble. I #8217;ve attempted in the past, and now I #8217;m contemplating it again. And I know if I do it I can #8217;t fail or else I #8217;ll be put on an IV again. I can #8217;t win. On a lighter note, I #8217;m actually incredibly proud of myself. At one point my drive to start a new life overcame my phobia and because of that I #8217;m now six months on testosterone.
I would still need to get my blood work done to check my levels. The needles aren #8217;t what I #8217;m afraid of, it #8217;s the veins.
Probably the most helpful response I #8217;ve ever gotten on this app. Wow. Seriously, thank you for sharing. Not many people have this fear and I #8217;m SO glad someone else understands.
Thank you!

Dude. This is the best comment I #8217;ve ever received. I #8217;m the exact same way, come at me with a tattoo gun and I #8217;m fine, cause you #8217;re exactly right it doesn #8217;t go into any plumbing, but come at me with that butterfly needle and I #8217;m done for. I wish you the best of luck on your labs, and I know you #8217;re badass and you #8217;ll be able to get that surgery one day. We #8217;re all in this together brother. And ya know what, I #8217;ll have a cup of coffee too! ~Cheers
Seems as if you #8217;re already there bro
Where did you get those shorts???

WRITING.TITLE: Does this look bad?, Me, colored pencil, 2020

WRITING.TEXT: Just body positive!
Every artist has a fun side :)
I appreciate that!! It #8217;s scary putting yourself out there!
Thank you so much!! I appreciate that!
This is actually a drawing referenced by a photo of my boyfriend! If you want I can send said photo or send progress pictures!
Good eye!! I actually had to go back over that part because it does look ashy. Not enough contrast.
I #8217;ve never gotten critique like this before. It #8217;s so overwhelming. I really appreciate this, thank you so much.

I had to screenshot it from my Instagram and Facebook (@emmettsart) because my phone I had it on previously shut down and nothing was salvageable. I feel as though this whole thing is suspicious so I may post the drawing in hand to clear up any confusion.
I appreciate it!!
I drew this with colored pencil
I drew it during a really bad breakup. I was feeling many horrible things and this is actually the person I was heartbroken over. Maybe TMI but that #8217;s why

I originally made my account for NSFW purposes, but quarantine has made it hard to express myself artistically, so I decided to start sharing my art here. You can check out my Instagram that #8217;s been up for years @emmettsart

I appreciate your kind words!! I was going through a really tough breakup, and decided to draw him outta my system. This image projected everything I felt about myself and him at the time.
Thank you! Many people are claiming it #8217;s fake, so I appreciate your backup!!
Thank you!!
He #8217;s a very tidy cat. Thank you!!
I used a gellyroll pen! I would recommend a higher quality pen though, as these ones dry out quickly.
Thank you so much! I really appreciate that!
Thank you so much!!! #128420;
About 15 hours total. It #8217;s fairly small only being about 4x4 in, but MAN was it tedious!
Prismacolor premiere :))
Tried that once, would not recommend. And thank you so much!!
Thank you!!!

I first did a light black base color, and for the lighter highlights I went over with a white pencil. (Its a pain in the ass to highlight over a thick base.) Once I had where I wanted the highlights I finished the black and then added the shine with the pen. I hope this helps!!
He needs to drop his hair routine for real
I #8217;ll take that into account next time!! Thank you! I realize it is definitely a bit too much cat
